thread.title: Eight new routes: Frontier Airlines connects the dots on its route map
thread.title_full: Eight new routes: Frontier Airlines connects the dots on its route map

author: Ben Mutzabaugh , USA TODAY
title: Eight new routes: Frontier Airlines connects the dots on its route map
text:
A file photo shows the latest paint job Frontier Airlines uses for its aircraft. (Photo: Frontier Airlines)
Tags Jetblue Airways O'Hare International Airport RW 16 CONNECT 34 TWEET 4 LINKEDIN 2 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Frontier Airlines announced eight new routes Tuesday, adding nonstop connections among cities it already serves.
Four of Frontier's new routes come in Las Vegas, expanding the airline's footprint there. Once the flights begin, Frontier will fly nonstop to 13 destinations from the city, including: Atlanta; Austin; Chicago O'Hare; Cleveland; Cincinnati; Denver; Orlando; St. Louis; and Washington Dulles.
On one route in particular — Las Vegas-San Francisco (SFO) — Frontier will try to turn a profit on what's become an ultra-competitive city-pair . Frontier will become the fifth carrier to fly nonstop between those airports, joining United, Southwest, Virgin America and JetBlue. Adding to the mix, two airlines — Southwest and Spirit — also fly between Las Vegas and SFO's cross-bay neighbor, Oakland International.
USA TODAY
JetBlue adds to competition on Las Vegas-San Francisco route
USA TODAY
Frontier removes departure time from boarding passes
Elsewhere, Frontier will add two routes from both Philadelphia and Orlando. All eight of the new routes included in Tuesday's announcement will begin Oct. 25. (Scroll down for a full list.)
From Philadelphia, the new service will give Frontier 10 seasonal or year-round routes, according to The Philadelphia Inquirer . It continues a reshaping of Frontier's operations in the greater Philadelphia area.
The carrier announced last month that it was ending all service at Delaware's Wilmington/New Castle Airport , about a 30-mile drive from Philadelphia International. That came after a quick build-up and nearly equally quick draw-down for Frontier there.
USA TODAY
Frontier Airlines' pullout leaves Delaware with no flights
USA TODAY
Frontier announces major expansion for Atlanta
Frontier also has built up a base at another nearby airport: New Jersey's Trenton-Mercer Airport. Frontier now flies 11 routes from that airport, which is located between the New York City and Philadelphia metro areas. The airport is about 45 miles from Philadelphia International and 75 from Midtown Manhattan.
Frontier once flew a peak of 18 routes from Trenton, but has pared that down to the current 11.
"We're focusing in Trenton on routes and on markets that work seven days a week," Daniel Shurz, Frontier Airlines' chief commercial officer, tells the Inquirer . "We're moving in the direction of flying the vast majority of our network on a daily basis."
Details on all eight of Frontier's newly announced routes
Las Vegas-Houston Bush Intercontinental: One daily round-trip flight on Airbus A319 aircraft
Las Vegas-Miami: One daily round-trip flight on Airbus A319 aircraft
Las Vegas-Milwaukee: One daily round-trip flight on Airbus A319 aircraft
Las Vegas-San Francisco: One daily round-trip flight on Airbus A320 aircraft
Orlando-Indianapolis: One daily round-trip flight on Airbus A320 aircraft
Orlando-Los Angeles: One daily round-trip flight on Airbus A319 aircraft
Philadelphia-Fort Myers: One daily round-trip flight, except Tuesdays, on Airbus A320 aircraft
Philadelphia-Montego Bay, Jamaica: Three weekly flights on Airbus A319 aircraft
